what: Retrieving climate data for a Region of Interest (ROI) using stations’ data
title: How to download climate data using ColOpenData
text: example, need create spatial polygon around city Manizales use ROI retrieve climate data. create spatial polygon need introduce coordinates geometry. simplicity, build box introducing 4 points bound box, transform created geometry sf object (see sf library details). visualization use leaflet. new ROI, can make first exploration check stations contained inside , using function stations_in_roi can see region 129 stations. Different categories recorded different stations, can checked column categoria. understand category station can use definition catalog provided DANE . Stations categories Climática Principal Climática Ordinaria records Dry-bulb temperature. stations suspended, means taking measurements moment. information found column estado , observation fecha_suspension different NA, since active stations suspension date. However, even station suspended, historical data (suspension date) can accessed. filter stations recorded information desired period, can delete stations suspension dates 2013. original 129 stations, 40 working whole period interest collected information Dry-bulb temperature. information, can access Dry-bulb temperature 2013 2016. , can use function download_climate_data. function following parameters: stations numeric vector containing stations’ codes start_date: character first date consult format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date: character last date consult format "YYYY-MM_DD". (Last available date "2023-05-31" frequency: character aggregation frequency. ("day", "week", "month" "year") tags: character containing climate tags consult aggregate: logical data aggregation, FALSE, returns data individual station area. (Default = TRUE) Stations’ codes obtained column codigo stations data. stations’ downloaded data can plot time series four years interest.  warning obtained indicates records 61 consulted days. might due stations maintenance.
code: # Define coordinates (Bounding box around Manizales) lat <- c(5.166278, 5.166278, 4.982247, 4.982247, 5.166278) lon <- c(-75.678072, -75.327859, -75.327859, -75.678072, -75.678072)  # Use sf to create a polygon and turn it into a geometry polygon <- st_polygon(x = list(cbind(lon, lat))) %>% st_sfc()  # Turn geometry into sf object roi <- st_as_sf(polygon)  # plot polygon for reference leaflet(roi) %>%   addProviderTiles("OpenStreetMap") %>%   addPolygons(     stroke = TRUE,     weight = 2,     color = "#2e6930",     fillColor = "#2e6930",     opacity = 0.6   ) stations <- what: Retrieving climate data for a Region of Interest (ROI)
title: How to download climate data using ColOpenData
text: retrieve climate data ROI country, without manually manipulating stations’ data, can use function download_climate_geom. function following parameters: geometry: sf geometry containing geometry given ROI. geometry can either POLYGON MULTIPOLYGON start_date: character first date consult format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date: character last date consult format "YYYY-MM_DD". (Last available date "2023-05-31" frequency: character aggregation frequency. ("day", "week", "month" "year") tags: character containing climate tags consult aggregate: logical data aggregation, FALSE, returns data individual station area. (Default = TRUE) use ROI created previous example.  can see, results exactly .
code: db_temperature_roi <- download_climate_geom(   geometry = roi,   start_date = "2013-01-01",   end_date = "2016-12-31",   frequency = "day",   tags = "TSSM_CON",   aggregate = TRUE ) ggplot(data = db_temperature_roi) +   geom_line(aes(x = date, y = TSSM_CON), color = "#106ba0") +   ggtitle("Dry-bulb Temperature") +   xlab("Date") +   ylab("Dry-bulb temperature [C]") +   theme_bw() #> Warning: Removed 61 rows containing missing values (`geom_line()`).

title: How to download climate data using ColOpenData
text: make download process even easier, avoid creation already known geometries like municipalities departments, ColOpenData offers extra function download data using areas’ DIVIPOLA code. DIVIPOLA codification standardized whole country, contains department’s municipalities’ codes. Departments two digits individual identification, municipalities three; however, usage function level municipalities, need concatenate , obtaining five digit number department municipality codes. codes municipality department can consulted following table. replicate previous example need code Manizales, “17001”, means code department Caldas “17” code Manizales inside department “001”. function download_climate require almost arguments download_climate_geom, replace sf object character containing DIVIPOLA code: code: character DIVIPOLA code area start_date: character first date consult format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date: character last date consult format "YYYY-MM_DD". (Last available date "2023-05-31" frequency: character aggregation frequency. ("day", "week", "month" "year") tags: character containing climate tags consult aggregate: logical data aggregation, FALSE, returns data individual station area. (Default = TRUE)
code: db_temperature_mpio <- download_climate(   code = "17001",   start_date = "2013-01-01",   end_date = "2016-12-31",   frequency = "day",   tags = "TSSM_CON",   aggregate = TRUE ) ggplot(data = db_temperature_mpio) +   geom_line(aes(x = date, y = TSSM_CON), color = "#106ba0") +   ggtitle("Dry-bulb Temperature") +   xlab("Date") +   ylab("Dry-bulb temperature [C]") +   theme_bw() #> Warning: Removed 61 rows containing missing values (`geom_line()`).

title: Documentation and Dictionaries
text: ColOpenData three modules: demographic, geospatial climate. available datasets different details aggregation naming system used retrieve data. datasets need source, given name, year additional details identification. can consulted using common framework: SOURCE_NAME_YEAR_DETAILS Currently, ColOpenData includes data official sources (DANE) (IDEAM). Name, year details different module, provide unique name dataset.

title: Documentation and Dictionaries
text: Demographic datasets available municipalities departments, contain data Houses Population four categories. Viviendas (Houses) Hogares (Homes) Personas Social (Social) Personas Demográfico (Demographic) datasets retrieved DANE, correspond observed data National Population Dwelling Census (CNPV). Naming stated follows: Source: DANE Viviendas: CNPVV Hogares: CNPVH Personas Social: CNPVPS Personas Demográfico: CNPVPD Year: 2018 Details: related individual dataset, can related identifier spatial level aggregation. details please check function list_datasets .

title: Documentation and Dictionaries
text: Geospatial datasets naming related level aggregation, since available Blocks Departments. datasets come DANE, part Geostatistical National Framework (MGN), 2018 includes summarized version National Population Dwelling Census (CNPV). Naming stated follows: Source: DANE Name: name related MGN CNPV: MGNCNPV Year: 2018 Department: DPTO Municipality: MPIO Municipality including Class MPIOCL Block: MZN Rural Sector: SETR Urban Sector: SETU Rural Section: SECR Urban Section: SECU Urban Zone: ZU

title: Documentation and Dictionaries

title: Maps and plots with ColOpenData
text: example using geospatial data level Urban Section city Tunja, Colombia. using demographic data included dataset generate visualizations using ggplot2 leaflet. First, download data using function download_geospatial. downloading, filter municipality code using DIVIPOLA code Tunja, “15001”. information DIVIPOLA please consult dataset . know column contains municipalities code filter Tunja, need dataset dictionary. download dictionary can use dictionary function. function uses dataset name download associated information. information please refer documentation dictionaries previously mentioned. exploring dictionary, can identify column contains individual municipality codes, MPIO_CDPMP. column contains concatenated code department municipality, unique identifier. calculation percentage houses internet connection urban section. need know number houses internet connection total houses section. dictionary get number houses internet connection STP19_INT1 total houses STVIVIENDA. calculate percentage follows:
code: # Download complete dataset secu <- download_geospatial("DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECU") #> Reading layer `MGN_ANM_SECCION_URBANA' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/ColOpenData/extdata/DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECU/MGN_NivelSeccionUrbana_Integrado_CNPV'  #>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 29197 features and 101 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -81.73271 ymin: -4.226085 xmax: -66.96209 ymax: 13.38684 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 # Urban section dictionary dict <- dictionary("DANE_MGNCNPV_2018_SECU") head(dict) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   variable   tipo  longitud descripcion                       categoria_original #>   <chr>      <chr>    <dbl> <chr>                             <chr>              #> 1 DPTO_CCDGO Text         2 Código del departamento           NA                 #> 2 MPIO_CCDGO Text         3 Código del municipio              NA                 #> 3 MPIO_CDPMP Text         5 Código concatenado que identific… NA                 #> 4 CLAS_CCDGO Text         1 Código de la clase 1 cabecera mu… NA                 #> 5 SETR_CCDGO Text         3 Código de sector rural            NA                 #> 6 SETR_CCNCT Text         9 Código de sector rural concatena… NA # Filter for Tunja tunja <- secu %>% filter(MPIO_CDPMP == "15001")  # Calculate internet coverage percentage tunja <- tunja %>% mutate(INT_PERC = round(STP19_INT1 / STVIVIENDA, 2))

title: Maps and plots with ColOpenData
text: ggplot2 can used generate static plots spatial data using geometry geom_sf.  Color palettes themes can defined plot using aesthetic scales, can consulted ggplot2 documentation.
code: ggplot(data = tunja) +   geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = INT_PERC), color = NA) # ggplot2 ggplot(data = tunja) +   geom_sf(mapping = aes(fill = INT_PERC), color = NA) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     panel.grid = element_blank(),     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank()   ) +   scale_fill_gradient("Percentage", low = "#10bed2", high = "#deff00") +   ggtitle(     label = "Internet coverage",     subtitle = "Tunja, Colombia"   )

title: Maps and plots with ColOpenData
text: dynamic plots can use leaflet, open-source library interactive maps. create plot first create color palette. previous color palette can generate interactive plot. package also includes open source maps base map like OpenStreetMap CartoDB. details leaflet, please refer package documentation.
code: # Color Palette colfunc <- colorRampPalette(c("#10bed2", "#deff00")) pal <- colfunc(100) # Leaflet leaflet(tunja) %>%   addProviderTiles(providers$CartoDB.Positron) %>%   addPolygons(     stroke = TRUE,     weight = 0,     color = NA,     fillColor = ~pal,     fillOpacity = 1,     popup = paste0(tunja$INT_PERC)   )

title: ColOpenData
text: ColOpenData package acquires wrangles Colombian socioeconomic, geospatial climate data. solves problem Colombian data issued different web pages sources using functions allow user select desired database download without exhausting acquisition process. ColOpenData developed Universidad de Los Andes part Epiverse-TRACE program.

title: ColOpenData
text: can install development version ColOpenData GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("epiverse-trace/ColOpenData")

title: ColOpenData
text: ColOpenData contains data two public data sources: National Administrative Department Statistics (DANE) Institute Hydrology, Meteorology Environmental Studies (IDEAM). available data divided three categories: Demographic: Demographic Socioeconomic data taken National Population Dwelling Census (CNPV) 2018, recent census available date. information presented answer three questions: many ?, ? live? information can consulted . Geospatial: data retrieved National Geostatistical Framework (MGN), includes maps summarized version 2018 census, aggregated spatial geometries. data available different aggregation levels including: Blocks, Urban Rural Sections, Urban Rural Sectors, Urban Areas, Municipalities Departments .information available . Climate: Climate data recovered backup information provided IDEAM, containing historical data first station country, May 31st 2023. backup includes temperature, precipitation, Solar Brightness, Wind Direction, among others. information can accessed . Documentation vignettes available three modules user vignettes.

title: ColOpenData
text: Similar R packages offered international communities, allowing user download census, geospatial climate data. cancensus: Canada censobr: Brazil tidycensus: US geofi: Finland climate
